raw_comment: I notice that in this graph, Indonesia has the highest percentage of older and younger people both agreeing that the world is getting better with each generation. I also notice that my country, the u.s. Has lower than 50% for older people and more than 50% percent for younger people. I was surprised to see that more people than I expected in my country were optimistic when interviewed, seeing as how the U.S. To me feels like one of the most socially divided countries in the world. I wonder why the countries in the lower half have the lowest numbers. Could it be that the living situations for these people are worsening, or are they worried about things like global warming and pollution affecting the world? This relates to me and my community because the u.s. Has surprising statistics. And i personally believe the world is getting worse because of the newer and older generations trying their hardest to separate themselves from each other. A good headline for this graph would be: opinions divided
ace_sentences: I notice a graph.
In the graph, Indonesia has the highest percentage of older people who agree that the world is getting better with each generation.
In the graph, Indonesia has the highest percentage of younger people who agree that the world is getting better with each generation.
I notice my country.
My country is the U.S.
In the graph, the percentage for older people in the U.S. is lower than 50 percent.
In the graph, the percentage for younger people in the U.S. is higher than 50 percent.
I was surprised.
I expected fewer optimistic people in the U.S.
In the interview, more people in the U.S. were optimistic than I expected.
The U.S. feels socially divided to me.
I wonder why the countries in the lower half of the graph have the lowest numbers.
It is possible that the living situations for these people are worsening.
It is possible that these people worry about global warming.
It is possible that these people worry about pollution affecting the world.
This graph relates to me and my community.
The U.S. has surprising statistics in the graph.
I believe that the world is getting worse.
I believe that newer generations try hard to separate themselves from older generations.
I believe that older generations try hard to separate themselves from newer generations.
The headline is: opinions divided.
